I can no longer start the Geronimo server.  Starting the server results in the
exception below.  

ServerUtil.getServer(configuration) in the launch method of
GenericServerLaunchConfiguration returns back my server type but loading the
adapter fails.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.GenericServerLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch(GenericServerLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:71)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:590)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:152)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.start(Server.java:974)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.synchronousStart(Server.java:1312)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.StartServerJob.run(StartServerJob.java:34)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

I have done some tesing with other servers IServer.loadAdapter() worked as
expected. Is there a way for me to get the latest Geronimo adapter to test this?
Also can you enable tracing.

Created an attachment (id=27386)
geronimo server adapter to test

Here is the plugins.  I have no idea what could be wrong, especially since the
server itself gets registered and the server def or plugin.xml hasn't changed.

Tracing helped... Found an CNF exception on my end that wasn't shown in the log
before. I fixed this and the problem is resolved.  Thanks.
Closing old bugs that haven't had any activity in a couple months. If this problem has not been verified or you still have problems, please open a new bug.
